' STOPPING ON HIGHWAY: When stopping for any purpose, park off the traveled portion of the
highway outside the line of traffic. If your vehicle is disabled, raising the hood or tying a handker-
chief to the door handle or radio antenna will help ;cgﬂ -attention to your predicament.

PASSING ZONE: As you drive observe the center-stripes on the roadway. Keep in the right-hand ; : ‘

lane and do not pass the car ahead while the solid line is on your side of the road. Posted speed : j _ ; | |

~ signs, warning and directional signs are placed along the highway for your guidance and protection. V : ’

When approaching another vehicle from either the front or rear, dim your lights. Remember courtesy
promotes safety. / | ,

IN CASE OF ACCIDENT: Maryland law requires the operator of a vehicle involved in an accident

to stop immediately, and remain at the scene of the accident until the following requirements have

' STOPPING ON HIGHWAY: When stopping for any purpose, park off the traveled portion of the
highway outside the line of traffic. If your vehicle is disabled, raising the hood or tying a handker-
chief to the door handle or radio antenna will help ;cgﬂ -attention to your predicament.

PASSING ZONE: As you drive observe the center-stripes on the roadway. Keep in the right-hand ; : ‘

lane and do not pass the car ahead while the solid line is on your side of the road. Posted speed : j _ ; | |

~ signs, warning and directional signs are placed along the highway for your guidance and protection. V : ’

When approaching another vehicle from either the front or rear, dim your lights. Remember courtesy
promotes safety. / | ,

to stop immediately, and remain at the scene of the accident until the following requirements have
